alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 3:49AM MST until January 15 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow, heavy at times. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, with local amounts in excess of 12 inches possible. Dangerous wind chills of 30 to 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins. Laramie Valley including the city of Laramie. Heaviest amounts north and northwest of Laramie near Rock River and Bosler. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning from 11 PM MST this evening until 11 AM MST Monday. Wind Chill Warning until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could may lead to frostbite on exposed skin in as as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills
